go_data.justification: TGFbeta regulates cellular differentiation and proliferation during development.
The large latent TGFbeta complex is distributed as an extracellular fibrillar matrix in the developing endocardial cushion tissue.
TGFbeta is a dimeric peptide growth factor which regulates cellular differentiation and proliferation during development.
TGFbeta is required to initiate the formation of endocardial cushion tissue and regulates endothelial-mesenchymal transformation.
TGFbeta binds to many proteins with a relatively high affinity.
